_header: Be merry and suffer as I thee vise
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 240.
_description: Suffer and be Merry — five quatrains (aaab) and 2-line burden (bb): ‘He is wise so most I goo / That can be mery & suffer woo’

OxfBal354.First Lines:
Be mery & suffer as I the viseWher euer thow sytt or
                    rise…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…Let care away & greve þe nowght& shake thy lappe
                    & lat it goExplicit
